comments.commentBody:
"
Why are Americans supposed to trust their government to people who don't know what they are talking about?" Because our representatives apparently do reflect the beliefs and knowledge of the people who elected them.

Is it too much to ask American legislators to be familiar with the actual facts that pertain to American policies?

All I know is what I read in the newspaper, and I am apparently better informed about Guantanamo than this bozo has bothered to make himself.

Why are Americans supposed to trust their government to people who don't know what they are talking about?

This is what American politics has come to. Republicans have to pander to intolerance, misogyny and bigotry in order to get elected. We have seen it in the last four election cycles, and it is nauseating. Sadly, if one wants to get the Republican nomination, one must abandon personal principles and chase after the most ignorant, extremist sectors of the extremist electorate. Then it is a mad scramble back to the center for the general election, and many candidates can't make it. What is really disgusting is the realization that these candidates aren't presenting a picture of their genuine views. The electorate is essentially voting for a puppet. Jeb is either going to be manipulated by this system, or he will flat-out lose.

This is also the fault of moderates who either get turned off by the elections, or are too lazy to vote.

Does anyone really think the networks (with the exception of PBS) have had real reporters in the last 25 years? Long ago network news decided to give us "personalities" to report the news, to go along with their transforming the evening news into a sort of "Entertainment Tonight" show.

So why are we shocked that Williams is into self-promotion if news personalities are merely Kardishians with a different schtick? Maybe NBC, ABC, etc. need a disclaimer similar to one for pretend doctors:"I am not a journalist, I only play one on TV."
Enough sarcasm folks, to literally make your head spin like in the Exorcist.

"We have people like senator Cotton to protect us from these evils."

Especially since Senator 'Tom' has dispensed with figuring out whether 'these evils' are guilty or innocent!
What? If this is Sep tire, say so. The Internet has no vocal expression.

Boy, aren't we glad that we have such a well reasoned, knowledgeable senator to protect us from those detainees.

How lucky we are that they can not be brought to the mainland to stand trial to determine their culpability. We have people like senator Cotton to protect us from these evils. As we can see, we need more people from Arkansas running the country, instead of those liberals from places like Chicago.
Integrity matters. Even his apology was lacking.
If he didn't get paid $10 million or so a year I might cut him some slack but for that paycheck he damn sure should be held to a higher standard.

Wrong Goldstein...his was not a misstatement...it was a lie. Many journalists have paid the price for not doing proper research and allowing stories to run that contain inaccuracies. This case is not in that category and is far worse than that. This is a man, trusted by millions, who knowingly and willingly fabricated a false story, complete with details, of an event that never happened for purposes of egomaniacal self-aggrandizement. I call on NBC to go back and fact-check all his stories for I would bet money that he has prevaricated on more than one occasion.
Doesn't matter "how many." The rest of us are not paid millions of dollars to report news.

No. Nor would Ernie Pyle, the WWII correspondent who actually died in battle. Brian Williams and his grandiosity are beneath contempt. Letterman got the coup interview. Watch how Williams takes a serious subject and plays it for laughs.

When Greenhouse last addressed this case she didn't, and today she doesn't, have the courage to mention Jonathan Gruber's famous remarks.

Personally, I cannot imagine that all those high-dollar democratic law writers would write "an exchange established by the state" when they meant one established by the feds. Has one of them stood up to claim the error and I missed it?

In any case, another unspoken fact of the situtation, the one that really matters to democrats, is that they no longer have the votes to pull of the legislative rube goldberg act that got the bill "passed" in an act of conniving overreach unequaled in our history. Nor can they achieve the simple correction that they would enact--and forestall this case-- were they in the majorities.

And the reason they cannot is that the voters removed enough of them from office for passing this despicable law.

I assume we're all aware that money only has value because we all agree it does, right? Money is meaningless outside of this "pale blue dot". It's equally meaningless to all other species on this planet. I think that's hilarious.

When I think about that I realize how funny it sounds when folks talk about money as if it were an absolute concept, like gravity. I find it funny that we spend so much time and energy deciphering and trying to predict financial events as if they were totally outside of our control while they only occur because we all agree that they can occur.

Most people don't understand the Bush vs Gore decision. What the Supreme Court did was to uphold the decision (I think it was 6-1) of the Florida Supreme Court, which by the way was mostly made up of Democrats. Further most people are unaware that the lawyers for Gore had earlier effectively petitioned the Florida Supreme Court not to allow the Florida Secretary of State to declare the winner of Florida (Bush in this case) in the defined time period as prescribed by Florida State Law. When asked why the state law directed the Secretary of State to declare a winner within a set period of time, it was reported that it was necessary to allow the loser to ask for a recount (there has to be a declared winner before a statewide recount can be requested). At that time lawyers for both Gore and Bush agreed that December 12th was the drop dead date. Gore prevailed in getting the delay, and the result was there was not enough time to complete the state wide recount before the agreed drop dead date, which was why the Florida Supreme Court rejected the second Gore request for an additional delay. In short, the Gore team lawyered themselves out of a state wide recount.

The video I just saw on CNN said that the pilot said the helicopter with Williams did take some "light arms fire". So... was it a complete lie or not? I feel like people are really passionately destroying Mr. Williams. Justified? I don't think I have all of the information yet.

I can't say I'm surprised NBC is glossing over this outrageous story.  All of the media hype on integrity, trust earned, his contract renewal, etc. What a joke! People make mistakes, however, when your journalistic integrity is compromised, why trust anything the network says? I really can't watch anymore. Apology a little too late I feel.
I think the Milky Way will be the way the defector is killed (poisoned candy bar)--otherwise, why show her loving them.
@Yelitza: That's a pretty cowardly comment. "Poor" in what sense?
@Jo Boost: We have lots of ethnic Russians living here in NYC.  If Putin didn't like he way they were being treated would he invade the U.S.?

This comment, from a fan of Stalin and Beria, is a good example of the stooge comments the Russian propaganda machine pays to have posted on publications like the NYT. Comrade Max, you need to go back for some retraining. You are way too transparent.

I hate to say so but sending arms to Kiev would only provide Putin with an excuse to openly dispatch Russian troops. What we need to do is to make it absolutely clear to Moscow that western Ukraine is now and forever part of Europe. If the Russians were to cross the Dneiper and attack Kiev they'd find NATO forces waiting for them on the other side. As for Donetsk, Luhansk, etc., it's best to give those people the autonomy they've demanded.  Let Putin spend more of Russia's diminishing resources to keep his brethren in the East from freezing this winter.

I took the rattling off of the long list of beers as showing a contrast to the Soviet system where you would not have a choice - just Sovietski Brewski.  When the camera was on Elizabeth as she was listening to the list, she just stopped short of rolling her eyes.  I lived in Eastern Europe just after the fall of the Berlin Wall and the locals kept asking the Americans why we always felt we needed so many product choices.  I felt that was what Elizabeth was thinking that same thing - "these Americans are so ridiculous with all of these beers!"  I burst out laughing

"I hope NBC shows some backbone and keeps Mr. Williams on."

They will... if his ratings hold up. That's all they care about.

I miss the old mcburney. Glad to see these guys alive and well. I played tues and thur night as well on Saturday mornings back in the 70's and 80's. I still remember some of those Saturday morning games as very intense. Thanks for the article- brought back many memories.
Go, Phil!  Nice action shot!  Thanks for the great piece, NYT.

It is one thing to make a mistake and apologize for it, but to fabricate the facts to make a news story more exciting is an unforgivable lapse in judgment. Soldiers who have survived such harrowing ordeals deserve our respect for putting their lives on the line; however, Brian Williams "fantasy" disrespects their valor - he should now do the only honorable thing he can by resigning from the public eye.
Perfect assessment.

Williams must resign. Who can believe anything he says after watching his interview with Letterman in which he recounts his phony brush with death in sociopathis detail -- and receives praise for his courage and fortitude with Jimmy Stewart-like "aw shucks" shrugs and creepy self-effacement. It's not some small slip. It's an elaborate act.

@Nellie-

Where is your outrage for what Sandusky did?
CTE is not a reasonable risk
Kids and young teenagers shouldn't play football at all!
